column4: Hi. Where can I find the plugin for xchat which will make it possible to put it in system tray?
Hi. I'm using amsn as IM and Thunderbird as an e-mail client. I want to be able to open up Thunderbird from amsn, what command do I add to amsn for it to work?
I've tried $mozilla-thunderbird but that just opens up the hotmail web login, and I'm using gmail..
Do I have to restart amsn or something, because it didn't work?
I'm using the automatix version of thunderbird
Will that command open TB from a terminal?  If so it's just an amsn thing, and then I'm lost.
Yes it opens TB from the terminal..
Maybe amsn needs the full path.
Try 'which mozilla-thunderbird' and using the output from that instead.
Do you use amsn? It says: $recipient = Recipient ..
